Blog Title: CSS Variables & Font Application in Frontend Development

Secondary Title: Ink Black Theme Color Scheme Design

Tertiary Title: Implementation of Gold Border & Green Interactive Effects

This is a regular text block focused on frontend development. The core design concept of the ink black theme is to pair low-saturation backgrounds with matte gold borders, retaining Chinese aesthetic elements while ensuring the interactive experience of modern web pages.

In frontend development, we commonly use var(--color-gold-3) to call CSS variables. This approach makes color scheme management more efficient and reduces maintenance costs. For example, font-family: Arial, "HongLeiXingShuJianTi", sans-serif enables separate configuration of Western and Chinese fonts.

1. Core Color System

  • Ink Black Series: --color-ink-1 to --color-ink-6 (smaller numbers mean darker colors)
  • Gold Series: --color-gold-1 to --color-gold-5 (variants like matte gold/champagne gold)
  • Interactive Green Series: --color-green-1 (olive green, used for hover/active states)

2. Font Loading Steps

  1. Import online fonts via CDN
  2. Declare custom fonts using @font-face
  3. Set font-family with Western fonts first, followed by Chinese fonts

3. Code Examples


:root {
--color-gold-1: #8a6d08;    /* Darkest matte gold */
--color-ink-2: #0f0f0d;     /* Core ink black */
--color-green-1: #5a9e5a;   /* Olive green */
}


function loadBlogContent(blogId) {
const blogPathMap = {
    1: "posts/first-blog.html",
    2: "posts/second-blog.html"
};
fetch(blogPathMap[blogId])
    .then(response => response.text())
    .then(html => {
        document.getElementById("blog-detail").innerHTML = html;
    });
}

Inline code example: Use document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function(){}) to ensure code executes after DOM is fully loaded;
